alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 8:37AM EST until December 12 at 5:29PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast and East Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from heavy rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring in the towns of Penobscot, Kenduskeag and Ellsworth. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Dexter, Newport, Blue Hill, Cherryfield, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Deer Isle, Veazie, Dedham, Castine, Kenduskeag and Steuben. - In the town of Penobscot the New Road, Dunbar Road and Southern Bay Road are closed due to standing or flowing water. In Kenduskeag the Kenduskeag Levant Road is reduced to one lane for flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
